comment:
Mr. Lee took time for one-on-one meetings, offering valuable advice and encouraging creative exploration with open-ended guidance. He was a great listener and cared deeply about each student. So, it was easy to talk to him and gain feedback for this course.

Studio was fun, but unclear assignments sometimes confused. Clearer instructions would help

Professor lee cannot teach. He gives unclear information to students. He is constantly late to class and berates students for being late as well. Mostly gives students 60s and 70s. He doesn't understands the assignments we are given and he has a lot of anger issues. He has been on the brink of screaming matches between students many times.

This professor is very unmotivated and discouraging. There was a problem about his grading system and when students approach the issue he found it threatening. His feedback was always confusing and not inspiring. I couldn't find a way to improve on my projects that would please him. I felt like I didn't learn anything this course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Very difficult and can seem stand-offish at times but wants to see his students succeed. Workload and critiques are tough but the work is worth it in the end. Does not stay later than the usual time for studio, make sure to get critiques early in classtime.

comment: Absolutely one of the worst professors I have ever had at KSU, he reads all his slides word for word for the lectures. He is not sympathetic. He has an excessive amount of work, more than studio work, and does not have leniency when it comes to grading. Very poor communication, and cannot speak English well so his lectures are hard to understand.
